s.text: Our "Letter From Washington" concerns an admirable (but possibly doomed) campaign to improve the style sense on the Microsoft campus.
We certainly don't intend to be a magazine of fashion, either in the sense of being about clothing or in the sense of following the fashion in general matters.
Wednesday (April 16) brings "Clothes Sense," our regular monthly column from Anne Hollander.

Often, we've discovered, the best way to frame an interesting and useful dialogue is not to get a liberal vs. a conservative, but to get two people from roughly the same part of the spectrum who disagree on the application of their shared values to a particular issue.
Not long ago, Bill Gates saw one of Slate's program managers, Peter Randall, walking across the campus, and observed, to no one in particular, "I'd kill for that tie."
(Dershowitz recently reviewed Amar's book on this subject for Slate.)
